Job summary We’re building an entirely new retail experience with no lines and no checkout. Our checkout-free shopping experience is made possible by our Just Walk Out Technology, which automatically detects when products are taken from or returned to the shelves and keeps track of them in a virtual cart. When a customer is done shopping, they just walk out! Shortly after, their credit card is charged for their purchases and a receipt is sent. In addition to Just Walk Out technology, we are creating a variety of other exciting customer experiences through inventions like Amazon One and Amazon Dash Cart. These products use a variety of technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a game-changing initiative. While you’ll be able to use existing Amazon systems when possible, you’ll be working on challenging problems that need creative solutions. You should be comfortable building prototypes, challenging assumptions, and thinking of creative ways to tackle challenges.

Job summary Amazon CloudFront is a web service for content delivery and one of the cornerstones of AWS. We give developers and businesses an easy way to distribute content (webpages, APIs, games, movies, live streams, etc.) and place it closer to end users to speed up the user experience. Key job responsibilities The CloudFront developer experience team is looking for a front-end engineer to join us in rethinking the way developers use CloudFront by crafting tools and experiences to delight our customers. In this role, you'll build frontend features and tools that our customers engage with on a daily basis to improve their experience using CloudFront. This includes rapid prototyping, converting designs into working user interfaces, and building frontend experiences and tooling in the browser and on the command line. As part of a the developer experience team, you'll be integral to the early planning stages of what our team delivers. Not only will you be expected to write code, but also provide your perspective as a developer into improving the experience of CloudFront for other developers. About the team Our team is made up of product managers, engineers, and UX designers focused on creating the best end-to-end experience for developers to deploy their applications behind a CDN. We aim to create an experience that "just works" for a broad set of use cases. We operate much like a startup: there is a high level of creativity, innovation, autonomy, trust, and agility. If you enjoy seeing the impact your work has on real customers and are passionate about improving developer productivity and workflows for developers globally, we should chat!

Job summary Amazon is hiring software engineers to help us revolutionize the pharmaceutical industry and we’re looking for passionate individuals who can help us on that journey. Amazon Pharmacy is a full service online pharmacy that sorts medication by the dose and provides convenient multi-dose packets, vials, and bulk medications to a patient's door. The industry is ripe for disruption and we’re working to deliver the best possible pharmacy experience for our customers. As a member of our engineering team, you will be at the intersection of the physical and digital world. You will be solving interesting and complex problems at every layer of the stack, and you will be helping to make a real difference for our end consumers. You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with engineering, product, clinical / distribution, and customer care teams. We are looking to hire software engineers of all levels to help us deliver a better pharmacy experience for our customers and make a lasting impact on the healthcare industry. Our ideal candidate would be someone who thrives in a fast-paced startup culture, enjoys solving complex and ambiguous problems, and passionate about helping others and building a positive and supportive team culture. Join us, if this is you!

Job summary Our team We are responsible for creating hiring solutions for millions of applicants and future Amazonians. Amazon has 1.2M employees worldwide with plans for continued growth. Here, you’ll be part of a team that builds scalable, international solutions impacting unprecedented number of candidate experiences. We create global solutions that not only scale up in volume, but also handle the complexity of diverse workflows and country specific rules/regulations. Our team is growing rapidly at multiple locations. If you have the drive, tenacity, an entrepreneurial spirit, and most importantly the day 1 spark to take on ambiguous problems head on, in a fast-paced environment, this is the place for you! The role As part of our growth and expansion, we are setting up brand new teams to build end-to-end hiring solutions on Native AWS from ground up. This solution will handle all phases of hiring process from job creation, search, and application to all the way candidate day 1 experience. As a Software Development Engineer, you will drive the development of services and assets for an external facing, mobile first, global solution that will be used by millions of applicants aspiring to work at Amazon. You will own automation of business processes using proven as well as evolving AWS services and other technologies to create a friction free customer experience. Your tier-one services will have highest standards and be available 24x7, scale under massive load, and perform consistently. We want you if - · You strive to build highly available, scalable, and performant tier-one services to power responsive, intuitive, and sleek experiences for customers. · You have high standards and drive a culture of excellence, grow and mature a young team to take them to the next level. · You are an excellent communicator, both verbal and written, and equally adept at communicating upwards and downwards. · You are curious, love problem-solving, diving deep, collecting data to make well informed decisions, but use sound judgement in the face of insufficient data. · You follow the latest technologies and motivate your teams to innovate. · You have strong leadership qualities, and a track record of delivering great solutions. Key job responsibilities In this role you will - · Be a technical leader that is not afraid to challenge the norms and innovate. · Own, drive, and deliver software solutions · Execute against project plans and delivery commitments. · Develop relationships with internal and external partner teams to move fast. · Help establish the long-term success strategy for your systems, development best practices, and operational excellence processes. · Collaborate with peers to ensure your strategies are in alignment with the rest of the development teams. · Develop junior and new team members by mentoring them on multiple fronts. A day in the life Daily activities include collaborating with other software developers and product team to define, design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain a variety of front and back-end solutions using native AWS services. Daily you will: · participate in stand-up, planning, leadership, and product meetings · write, test, review high-quality code · research and design novel software solutions · estimate, write, and update requirements, design, and required documentation Once a month, be part of on-call rotation to support any customer impacting incidents. Team has a very low record of incidents requiring work outside normal hours. You'll help improve and maintain our high standards. About the team Our team is new and growing. As an early team member, you'll help create and define the processes and tooling we use to delight our customers. Our goal is to provide job candidates with a frictionless hiring journey from application submission to Day 1. We also provide critical data to our internal work force staffing partners that provide key insights improving the candidate experience. We use Scrum and strive for continuous improvement. Here, your contributions matter by helping shape the team environment and how we achieve our goals.

Experience of successfully mentoring junior SDEs. High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired. History of teamwork and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done. Experience architecting large-scale multi-tier web applications. Job summary Do you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment, solving complex technical problems and delivering innovative solutions? Amazon is looking for a dynamic, innovative and accomplished front-end engineer to join the Customer and Brand Protection Team. Our mission is to make Amazon the safest and most trusted place worldwide to transact online. Amazon runs one of the most dynamic e-commerce marketplaces in the world, with nearly 2 million sellers worldwide selling hundreds of millions of items in ten countries. Have you ever thought about what it takes to manage risk in billions of transactions, including digital transactions and subscriptions? Do you like to innovate and simplify? We're looking for a results-oriented, and driven front-end engineer who can help us create the next generation of Web applications with bleeding edge front-end technologies for Brand owners. You will work closely with customers, engineers, designers, and product managers from conception through delivery on world class applications. If you have passion for customer experience and front-end web development while having fun and exploring new technology, then Customer and Brand Protection Team is the place for you!

Job summary While our problems may be complex, our solutions should be simple. Are you a Software Development Professional yearning to find a place to take your career to the next level? Is problem solving and troubleshooting to design and create unique software solutions part of your DNA? Then it’s time to take a look at the Seller Experiences team! Read on to learn more… Our goal is simple – the Seller Experience Team seeks to make online selling more attractive to a broader demographic of potential retailers through superior scalable object-oriented code. Your work will directly impact cost, selection and the customer experience for both internal and external customers alike. As an experienced Software Engineer, you will help drive the global expansion of our applications and services, with a significant opportunity to define a Seller and Buyer facing Amazon platform. You will develop a scalable framework for the improvement of the Seller Experience as you work collaboratively across Amazon development teams to integrate their services with our applications and platform. Because you take pride in setting the standard for engineering excellence, you are a hands-on, pragmatic problem solver that easily balances trade-offs between competing interests. You thrive in a fast-moving team environment where you are able to juggle complex dependencies and requirements while producing optimal solutions.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
An available online portfolio
1+ years of design experience

Currently enrolled in Bachelor’s/ Master’s/- Doctorate in Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, Design, or other equivalent discipline and graduating after August/September 2023
Must be eligible and available for a full-time (40h / week) 6 month internship between January to June 2023
Experience with Figma

Job summary
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun.

Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas.

Amazon Robotics internship/co-op/full-time opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities.

The UX team seeks a UX Co-op who is passionate about applying user-centered methods to real world product development. Qualified candidates are passionate about implementing design thinking and user-centered methods as an integrated part of an interdisciplinary product team. A successful candidate is curious and driven, with a proclivity to show designs, diagrams, and visual representations of both problems and solutions as they work toward understanding both the problem and the solution.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
The UX team is involved with all user-facing products and systems developed at AR. These range from dashboards and monitoring displays that keep operations managers informed, to command panels that enable interaction with and diagnostics of manipulation arms for maintenance engineers, to workstations that empower associates to perform their duties in a safe, ergonomic, intuitive, and rewarding manner, to the handheld devices that alert associates to the tasks that most need their attention. We develop design artifacts to represent these user needs, design systems to empower scalable and usable interface development, and validation strategies to ensure AR products measurably improve user performance and experience.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
Bachelor's degree in a related design field or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of professional experience.
A portfolio demonstrating success in effective user-centered design solutions.
4+ years of experience building out templated design systems, mockups, and prototyping in 2D/3D.
4+ years of experience working with offset printing, dielines, color, material, and recyclability of paper products (corrugate, paper pulp, SBS).
About Ring
Since its founding in 2013, Ring has been on a mission to make neighborhoods safer. From the first-ever video doorbell, to the award-winning DIY Ring Alarm system, Ring’s smart home security product line, as well as the Neighbors app, offer users affordable whole-home and neighborhood security. At Ring, we are committed to making home and neighborhood security accessible and effective for everyone — while working hard to bring communities together. Ring is an Amazon company. For more information, visit www.ring.com. With Ring, you’re always home.

About the Role
The UX Designer, Education (UXD) is responsible for the user experience and design of Ring’s physical and digital product documentation across packaging and site; Guiding global technical and help center publication design systems to meet customer needs throughout their learning journey. The UXD leverages their expertise to create, refresh, and enhance complex device setup flows for a cohesive user education experience at scale. They utilize user research and data to identify customer pain points and drive improvements for comprehension, accessibility, and sustainability.

About You
You are an organized self-starter with experience working on established and successful global design systems in a scale-up environment. You consider details and tailor products with human-centered thinking—considering every type of learner. You bring an expertise of layout, typography, illustration, and press constraints to support complex device user education and manufacturing needs. You’re an effective collaborator—communicating and escalating blockers as required to ship products on-time and on-brief. Above all, you are focused on solving real problems for real people through research, design, and iteration.

Key job responsibilities
A day in the life
You’ll partner with our team of designers, program managers, producers, and writers to help inform, improve, and guide development of Ring’s device documentation design systems. Working closely with interdependent cross-functional teams (User Research, UX Content, Product Management, Product Integrity, Compliance, Legal), you’ll use design thinking and data to contribute user-centric ideas across packaging, app, and site to reinforce consistency and cohesion for an optimal learning journey along all user education touch-points.

About the team
PX is a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team of designers, engineers, producers, writers, product managers, and program managers working together to bring the Ring product vision to life. We enjoy what we do, have big ideas, and tackle complex problems by taking risks that drive global solutions. In every work stream, we immerse ourselves in insights, and invent on behalf of our customers, Neighbors. We brainstorm scenarios they will benefit from and solutions to pain points—crafting innovative products that aim to connect the physical and digital customer journey.

Job_Description:
About Us
Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.
We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.
About the Role
Designers at Twitch are involved in development from project conception all the way through execution and iteration. You will do hands-on research and collaborate closely with engineers. If you are a champion for designing for humans and create playful and caring software for your customers, you will flourish on this team.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
8+ years of design experience
An available online portfolio

Job summary
We're on a journey to build something new! Come join our team and build new research, discovery and shopping products that connect customers with their vehicle of choice. In this role, you'll be designing the new product for a new customer experience on Amazon.

In order to be considered for this role you must submit a link to your portfolio.

We’re looking for a design leader who:
In this role, you will be reviewing designs regularly with senior executives. You will be expected to educate down, up and out on your design decisions and back them up with data/customer insight. You will be responsible for managing your own work queue and should demonstrate an ability to work around difficult design limitations. You’ll be an advocate for our customer experience, and understand your Amazon customer base, the competition and industry.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
This role is one of the first on a newly formed team in with a vision to create innovative automotive discovery and shopping experiences on Amazon, providing customers better convenience and more selection. We’re collaborating with other experienced teams at Amazon to define the future of how customers research and shop for cars online.

We are also open to candidates in Detroit, or Arlington / D.C. areas.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
You Have: • 2+ years experience as a UX designer, product designer, or interaction designer • An aesthetic sense and the ability to design a flexible and cohesive solution across many points of input • Empathy for those you work with who will use the design system day in and day out
Job summary About Us: Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog. About the Position: Twitch's community of broadcasters and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality visual experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. Your ability to summarize design system needs into functional, beautiful solutions will be paramount for achieving success. The Core UI Design System team at Twitch empowers our Designers and Engineers alike with consistent, accessible and aesthetic building blocks that bring their products to life. As part of this team, you will bring your touch to every product on Twitch as the backbone of the UI on our platform. We're looking for a gifted designer to establish new design patterns while building upon existing ones. We offer a series of stimulating problems, an environment that's exciting, motivating, fun, and new. The Core UI team presents the unique opportunity to work directly with your users every day and respond to their needs in real time. If you are an advocate for designing for humans and create playful and caring software for your customers, you will flourish on this team. This position can be located in Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; and Salt Lake City, UT or Remote US You Will: • Collaborate with engineers and designers across the company • Take full ownership of your designs from start to finish, including collaboration with partner teams, mockups, integration into the design library, documentation and hand off to engineering • Participate in the planning and ideation process for new components and patterns • Design UI components by using feedback, data, and an understanding of accessibility guidelines

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
7+ years professional experience as a UX Designer, Interaction Designer, Product Designer, or related discipline
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Design, or a related field, or commensurate industry experience
Portfolio of work demonstrating ability to create customer experiences across a range of touch-points as well as proficiency in Interaction Design
Knowledge and experience working with Design Systems, Responsive Design, Mobile UX, and iOS App development nuances that impact design decisions and customer experiences
Proficiency in design software such as Figma, Sketch, and prototyping tools.
Experience working cross-functionally with front and back end developers.
Job summary
We are looking for a UX Designer that will evolve the customer experience throughout the online shopping journey. From personalized browsing and discovery, to filtering and product evaluation, all the way to receiving boxes of the highest quality, established and emerging fashion brands, at their front doors. As a UXD at Shopbop, you will have the opportunity to own UX initiatives from start to finish, designing with the rigor and customer obsession expected of high performing Amazon teams. Partnering closely with Product Managers to help assess, optimize, and define performance metrics for both new and existing features and roadmap priorities. As the customer advocate in every meeting, you will conduct user research and usability studies, sharing customer insights, and how they influence your design decisions, with stakeholders and leadership.

Key job responsibilities
You will own the end-to-end experience for products that span the Shopbop mobile app and responsive website. Designing experiences that are fit for luxury brands; identifying and eliminating barriers to purchasing designer clothing, shoes, accessories, and beauty products online.
As the ideal candidate you are a mobile first design thinker who sees around corners to create a cohesive vision across our mobile app and web experiences to deliver a unified customer experience. You see patterns and connect dots that identify opportunities for systematic enhancements. When met with new information, you are able to adapt and design solutions iteratively, for fast and incremental deliveries to our customer, that align with and move towards a future vision.
You are a self-starter who helps reduce ambiguity by facilitating cross-team communication and a strong desire to learn and be curious. Working closely with a multi-disciplinary team of product managers, developers, merchandisers, customer service, and stakeholders, you will lead the definition, design, and delivery of key initiatives. You will plan and prioritize your roadmap to support the successful execution of luxury shopping experiences, presenting to stakeholders and leadership, and overseeing the quality of in-progress development through to final launch and beyond.

About the team
Shopbop is the global online fashion destination for style inspiration and discovery, offering customers all over the world a comprehensive and curated selection from over 1,000 established and emerging designers. Shopbop provides world-class customer service, and fast, free shipping worldwide. Shopbop is a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc, and globally recognized and trusted fashion retailer selling only quality contemporary designer merchandise. This role is flexible and open to remote, preferably near Amazon offices in Seattle, Miami, Madison, or New York.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
8+ years of design experience
An available online portfolio

Job summary
Amazon Registry Services Inc. (“ARSI”) is one of Amazon's truly greenfield opportunities, working to fundamentally change the fabric of the Internet by re-imagining how Top Level Domains (TLDs) are used as the core of an individual or organization’s Internet presence. We partner closely with teams across Amazon (i.e. AWS, Alexa, Echo, Kindle, Amazon Pay, and others) to work backwards from the customer to build disruptive new services, solutions, and business models.

We are looking for an experienced UX Designer to lead UX as we build products in key verticals to support the launch of Amazon’s TLDs. If you’re interested in a start-up like experience at Amazon, and are passionate about learning fast through experimentation, then this is the role for you!

As a Senior UX Designer, you will have oversight of all registry customer-facing UX. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define the product features and by driving user experience across our TLDs. You will partner with Product and Engineering to turn product requirements into usable, useful, and delightful customer experiences. A commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills are requirements. You should be customer-obsessed and demonstrate a track record of building great experiences for customers across a variety of product and service categories.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for designing innovative user interfaces informed by customer research, industry best practices, and iterative testing. They will be able to explore multiple design solutions to a given problem or feature and communicate those solutions visually through sketches, user flows, wireframes, functional prototypes, and/or high-fidelity designs. This person will feel passionate about delivering quality UX across a variety of gateways and devices. They will possess excellent communication skills, strong project management skills, and the ability to relentlessly advocate for the customer while delivering results in a fast-paced environment. Finally, they will have succeeded and thrived delivering high quality UX in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast. Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, excited to work in a “green field”, wear many hats, and work in a highly collaborative environment that is more startup than big company.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
7+ years of experience as a UX designer, product designer, or similar UX-related role
5+ years of experience creating journey maps, user flows, and wireframes (low and high fidelity) for multi-device websites and applications
Portfolio of UX work for review.
Job summary
We have exciting things going on in the Enterprise Engineering organization, and we’re looking for UX designers to help enhance our customer journeys.. In Enterprise Engineering, we build the software, services, and infrastructure that enable Amazon teams across the world to do their work on a daily basis. We are the intersection of AWS technology and the need for engineering and infrastructure solutions at Amazon’s scale. As a builder-centric organization, we use AWS technology to reshape and reinvent the traditional enterprise services. We succeed when we make Amazonians around the world more effective and efficient.

Key job responsibilities
Enterprise Engineering is seeking a talented and passionate UX designer in our design and research studio. This designer will have a significant impact on our business as they contribute to the design direction of the future of Enterprise Engineering including large scope unreleased products. Throughout the strategy, design, and development lifecycle, this designer will work collaboratively with a strong design team, engineers, product managers and executives in a highly visible role interfacing directly with their customers - passionate engineers.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We care about your career growth too. Once you join the team, you and your manager will jointly craft a career plan and you'll review it regularly to ensure you're on track to meet your goals. Whether your goals are to explore new technologies, take on bigger opportunities, or get to the next level, we'll help you get there. Our business is growing fast and our people will grow with it.

Work/Life Balance
It’s not about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.


Contribute to the design of useful, usable, and desirable products in a team environment.
Understand customers and their needs through market analysis, customer research, and feedback.
Use business requirements to assist in developing use cases and high-level requirements.
Design the architecture, interface, and interaction flow of services and experiences.
Develop personas, customer journey maps, conceptual diagrams, wireframes, and prototypes.
Facilitate the design process, present and iterate design solutions.
Chart a course for yourself in ambiguous situations. Mentor and assist junior designers and interns.

Strong verbal communication and presentation skills.

Job summary Do you want to disrupt the financial space by creating the best in class designs for Amazon’s payments products that reach millions of customers? Do you have a desire to contribute to the design strategy and execution for a fast-growing business with significant impact on our customers? Amazon Payment Products manages all Amazon and partner-branded payment services such as co-branded credit cards, third party credit cards and reward redemption programs. We are continuously adding new market-leading features and product innovations. Amazon is looking for strategic thinker with hands-on expertise in developing world class product and marketing experiences that delight customers. You are a creative wizard with 5+ years of experience designing world class brands that people desire and use every day. You are an organized self-starter that can deal with ambiguity and are always on the lookout for ways to improve the customer experience. You are an excellent collaborator and have no problem presenting–and defending–your ideas to other designers, product managers, and company leaders. You thrive in a fast-paced, startup-like environment. You are visual master of your craft, capable of designing inspiring content and campaigns that captivate audience worldwide. Above all you are passionate about solving real problems for real people through research, design, and iteration. You will work with members of the design and marketing teams to create experiences that are engaging, useful, and solution oriented. You will apply customer data and insights to tailor your designs to customers’ needs and pain points. You’ve set the standard for design solutions with your world-class design talent, command of visual principals, masterful typographic skills, and keen attention to detail. About the team We are a global team of product managers, marketers, researchers, and designers that serve tens of millions of customers worldwide through a portfolio of products. Our goals are to delight them with best-in-class rewards, easy access to credit and the simplicity to sell or buy cross-border on Amazon in their local currency. We have a think-big culture where every voice is heard and are passionate about continuous learning, career development, and collaboration.

Job summary Are you looking to make a big impact and lead a talented team of designers and researchers in pioneering design for financial technology? Are you passionate about designing innovative, user friendly products on behalf of Amazon’s internal finance, tax, and accounting customers? If so, we are looking for a Manager of Design to manage a team of designers for Amazon’s Finance Technology (FinTech) organization. FinTech is an organization where people, technology and innovation come together to build products and solve problems for Amazon. We own technology products responsible for handling billions of dollars worth of transactions in multiple currencies that support Amazon Finance, Tax, and Accounting worldwide. This is your chance to make history by designing intuitive and highly functional user experiences for cutting edge financial technology. The Role This is a great opportunity for a highly motivated person interested in taking a leadership role delivering innovative and intuitive internal web applications through management of a design team. As a Manager of Design, you will be managing a team of talented designers and researchers who provide the “a to z” of research, design, and execution across a portfolio of financial products with direct access to end users. The ideal candidate combines systems thinking with customer obsession and creates a sustainable and scalable Human-Centered design processes that help the team to innovate and create the most intuitive interfaces for our internal customers. Key job responsibilities * Execute on FinTech UX Design and Research organization’s vision and mission * Hire, develop, and manage UX designers and researchers * Go deep on customer insights and analytics to identify unseen opportunities and drive product and experience innovation * Lead brainstorming sessions, design reviews, and quick, iterative user research for ideation and concept refinement * Drive cross-discipline collaboration from idea conception to implementation * Guide team in iterating on a design problem using the appropriate process and level of fidelity * Work with product managers and engineering teams to create solutions that meet a high customer and product experience bar and align with technology capabilities * Set standards for team’s operational and design excellence, promoting integration of design into product development processes, and dive deep as needed to support work efforts * Up-level quality of team’s detailed designs, applying best practices within industry * Collaborate with other design leaders across the Fintech UX Design and Research org and Amazon to raise the bar for design and align on best practices
* Experience with designing products for Finance users * Demonstrated ability to influence product teams and product decisions via design and research * A track record of innovating work * Master’s degree in Design, HCI, or related field or equivalent professional experience Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Job summary The Central Science Team within Amazon’s People Experience and Technology org (PXTCS) uses economics, behavioral science, statistics, and machine learning to proactively identify mechanisms and process improvements which simultaneously improve Amazon and the lives, well-being, and the value of work to Amazonians. We are an interdisciplinary team, which combines the talents of science and engineering to develop and deliver solutions that measurably achieve this goal. We are looking for a Director of UX Research and Design to deliver products and experiences at scale with universal appeal. You will drive design impact across Amazon as you help shape our connection to our employees throughout PXT product portfolios and influence the development of experiences and services that delight out employees. In this role, you will be responsible for managing a multi-disciplinary design team to create and ship elegant, intuitive experiences that engage and delight users. You will inspire the team to think big, explore new ideas, and to invent and simplify design concepts into globally scalable expressions. You will bring high level taste-making, hire and develop the best talent in the industry, and build trusted partnerships with a variety of product and engineering teams. You will identify, define, and teach best practices within the organization and the broader design community to unify design processes, foster innovation, and improve efficiency throughout the product development lifecycle. We are flexible on location for this role which could be located at many of our offices in Arlington, VA, New York City, San Francisco, Dallas, Atlanta or Seattle. Key job responsibilities • Provide the vision to transform User Experience design for PXTCS and PXT experience across the entire ecosystem of products and services. • Advocate for our employees and the design community inside and outside of Amazon. • Evolve the use of diverse inputs to identify and define new concepts and customer problems as opportunities for expressive design solutions. • Influence and implement big idea design thinking with VP-level executives across Amazon.

Job summary Who we are Are you interested in shaping the future of entertainment? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? Prime Video is changing the way hundreds of millions of people watch streaming video in over 200 territories around the world. With one service, we enable customers to watch hundreds of thousands of movies, TV series, live events, and linear channels on web, mobile, TV and emerging clients like VR and multimodal devices. Our vision is to build on our success by becoming the world’s most lovable premium video streaming service. Join us to help find new ways to bring smiles to our customers’ faces. Who you are We are seeking a Sr. Manager, UX Design, to define, articulate and champion the future of the Prime Video customer experience. In this role, you will be responsible for developing our innovation process, working closely with our UX Research team to identify opportunities for innovation, and leading project teams to design and deliver new experience concepts. You will define, evangelize and facilitate a cross-functional innovation process across the Prime Video organization. You will build, lead and develop a core team of innovation-focused UX, visual and motion designers. Key challenges include synthesizing customer needs and macro trends to extrapolate a 3 to 5-year vision and influencing across the UX team and with partner teams to lead a holistic approach to innovation. You will partner closely with product, engineering, and data teams across diverse clients and platforms. You will inspire your team and partners to invent new ways for customers to experience Prime Video and Amazon Original content. You will advise joint roadmaps, work with our research team to identify unmet customer needs, lead divergent thinking to inspire creativity, and spend time with customers to build empathy. Your team will propose new customer experiences as well as find new ways to improve existing ones. You will have a global impact for Amazon and Prime Video. To be successful in this role, you will have designed innovative products, services and multi-modal systems, and you will need to understand how to implement design strategies across multiple devices and device types. To accomplish this, you will need to attract, retain, and develop world class talent. We welcome innovators and collaborators, as you will regularly find yourself in uncharted territory, where the key to your success will be to get ahead of the curve, and you’ll be creating solutions for exciting and ambitious ideas for which no interaction paradigm currently exists. Key job responsibilities --Build and facilitate a repeatable, cross-functional process for customer-centered innovation at Prime Video --Build, mentor and lead a diverse team of world class design practitioners --Create the vision for developing, communicating, and implementing the future of Prime Video user experience; follow through with the processes and tactics to implement the vision --Produce vision videos, user flows, wireframes, prototypes, user interface specifications --Work with the research team to initiate both generative user experience research and evaluative testing processes --Create reporting mechanisms and standardization for the user experience innovation process --Measure the success and effectiveness of the UX innovation team --Conduct analyses of real usage data to inform UX innovation efforts --Work closely with our product management partners to develop a shared vision and then lead a process to define and design an experience that delivers on our shared objectives --Partner with technology teams to ensure we leverage the scale offered by our platform without compromising on core experience principles --Develop an informed set of core values regarding user experience, technology, and business communication and present them concisely --Work strategically with other team leaders and team members across the organization
--Experience designing UX for streaming video or other entertainment services Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
8+ years of experience as a product designer or similar

A portfolio listed on your resume demonstrating examples of prototypes, concepts and projects
Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience
Fluency in best practices for mobile and tablet design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques

Job summary
Are you ready to drive the next generation of shopping innovations at Amazon? When words just aren’t enough to describe what customers are looking for, they often turn to other methods such as camera-based search, or using the picture of a celebrity to find inspiration for their fashion purchases. When images aren’t enough to convince customers that a piece of furniture will look good, they want to turn to Augmented Reality to envision how that furniture item would match their living room décor.

Starting in 2009, the Visual Search team has thus far launched many visual search solutions on the Amazon App that use computer vision and machine learning/deep learning to help customers complete their shopping missions more easily; multiple internal teams at Amazon (devices, Kindle, Seller services, etc.) also use our libraries and APIs to deliver solutions to their own customers. We are a full stack shop, and our team capabilities cover the whole solution spectrum, ranging across applied science (Computer Vision and Deep Learning), large scale engineering services, product management, UX design, and mobile app development for iOS and Android. However, it’s still Day 1, and this is your chance to make history in the new era of shopping.

The Visual Search & Augmented Reality team is looking for a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Senior Product Designer to join the team in our downtown Palo Alto, CA location.

As a Senior Product Designer, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from conceptualizing the next generation of visual shopping applications to designing incremental features. You will be expected to use your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, including your advanced prototyping expertise.

You are strategic and highly collaborative and will work closely with a team of passionate designers, product managers, and software developers to create the conceptual and interaction flows and prototypes for new and existing applications and experiences. You will be a leading voice for customers, diving deep on their needs and aspirations to help them realize their goals. Along the way, you will be expected to use your full range of interaction design, prototyping and production skills. You will also mentor and coach junior designers.

Responsibilities:

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
10+ years of industry experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar design-related role
4+ years of mobile design experience
An available online portfolio

Job summary
eero (an Amazon company) is looking for a Senior Manager, UX Design to join our Product, Design, and Engineering organization to deliver the perfect internet experience for all of eero’s end customers. Our ease of setup and use, combined with our commitment to simplicity and customer security and privacy, have made wifi simpler than ever before for our customers. In this role, you will iterate on and extend upon eero’s existing design culture, building a customer experience that meets every customer segments needs. As the UX Design leader for our mobile application, you will meet with and empathize with our customers to gain an understanding of their needs. You will collaborate with engineers, product managers, executives, and other designers driving design throughout the strategy and development lifecycle. In addition, you will be a design thought leader and mentor other designers.

Key job responsibilities

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
15+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, product designer or similar role designing mobile, web, and/or other applications
10+ years of experience successfully leading and managing large multi-disciplinary design teams
An online portfolio of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions across desktop and mobile devices
Excellent communication, presentation, and storytelling skills
Proven experience with rapid, iterative research, design and development processes
Proven track record presenting to and influencing people, from other designers to senior executive management
Experience presenting to and effectively advising senior leaders outside of design

Title: Amazon Robotics - UX Design Co-op - Spring 2023
Job_Description:
Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or 8+ years professional experience a user experience designer, interaction designer, or similar role
5+ years of experience leading design teams as a UX, product or interaction design manager
An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience leading teams in creating user-centered design solutions
Experience presenting to and influencing senior management.

Job summary The Appstore team is seeking a passionate Head of UX Design to help create world-class experiences that impact millions of customers worldwide. This role leads all Appstore UX initiatives across all of our devices (FireTV, Fire Tablets, 3P Mobile Android, Desktop/Windows 11, and more) and is responsible for providing seamless and friction free experiences that surprise and delight both our end customers and developers. The Head of UX Design must lead, hire, develop and manage a high-performing team of UX/VX designers and researchers. You inspire designers to do their best work through your vision, communication, coaching, and problem solving. Your team will define early concepts, articulate end-to-end experiences, and craft elegant design solutions across a range of devices and modalities at global scale while collaborating closely with design, research, product, and engineering peers within Appstore, the Amazon Devices organizations and partner teams. Key job responsibilities • Create the vision for developing, communicating, and implementing the end customer and developer Appstore experience across devices/surfaces • Grow, develop, and lead a talented team of experienced UX designers and researchers • Model excellence in design and champion mental models across features and product releases •Use systems-level design thinking to drive design solutions from your team that scale •Influence cross-team conceptual development; working with members from research, engineering, product management, business development and others

Title: Sr. UX Designer, Shopbop UX Team
Job_Description:
7+ years professional experience as a UX Designer, Interaction Designer, Product Designer, or related discipline
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Design, or a related field, or commensurate industry experience
Portfolio of work demonstrating ability to create customer experiences across a range of touch-points as well as proficiency in Interaction Design
Knowledge and experience working with Design Systems, Responsive Design, Mobile UX, and iOS App development nuances that impact design decisions and customer experiences
Proficiency in design software such as Figma, Sketch, and prototyping tools.
Experience working cross-functionally with front and back end developers.
Job summary
We are looking for a UX Designer that will evolve the customer experience throughout the online shopping journey. From personalized browsing and discovery, to filtering and product evaluation, all the way to receiving boxes of the highest quality, established and emerging fashion brands, at their front doors. As a UXD at Shopbop, you will have the opportunity to own UX initiatives from start to finish, designing with the rigor and customer obsession expected of high performing Amazon teams. Partnering closely with Product Managers to help assess, optimize, and define performance metrics for both new and existing features and roadmap priorities. As the customer advocate in every meeting, you will conduct user research and usability studies, sharing customer insights, and how they influence your design decisions, with stakeholders and leadership.

Key job responsibilities
You will own the end-to-end experience for products that span the Shopbop mobile app and responsive website. Designing experiences that are fit for luxury brands; identifying and eliminating barriers to purchasing designer clothing, shoes, accessories, and beauty products online.
As the ideal candidate you are a mobile first design thinker who sees around corners to create a cohesive vision across our mobile app and web experiences to deliver a unified customer experience. You see patterns and connect dots that identify opportunities for systematic enhancements. When met with new information, you are able to adapt and design solutions iteratively, for fast and incremental deliveries to our customer, that align with and move towards a future vision.
You are a self-starter who helps reduce ambiguity by facilitating cross-team communication and a strong desire to learn and be curious. Working closely with a multi-disciplinary team of product managers, developers, merchandisers, customer service, and stakeholders, you will lead the definition, design, and delivery of key initiatives. You will plan and prioritize your roadmap to support the successful execution of luxury shopping experiences, presenting to stakeholders and leadership, and overseeing the quality of in-progress development through to final launch and beyond.

About the team
Shopbop is the global online fashion destination for style inspiration and discovery, offering customers all over the world a comprehensive and curated selection from over 1,000 established and emerging designers. Shopbop provides world-class customer service, and fast, free shipping worldwide. Shopbop is a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc, and globally recognized and trusted fashion retailer selling only quality contemporary designer merchandise. This role is flexible and open to remote, preferably near Amazon offices in Seattle, Miami, Madison, or New York.

Title: Sr. UX Designer, Shopbop UX Team
Job_Description:
Excellent product management, problem solving and communication skills; experience in interacting with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels.
Strong software development background with experience in software development cycle, and in managing and delivering large cross-functional programs and product releases.
Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects and programs.
Ability to think both strategically and tactically and to drive execution. Should be equally comfortable with long-term planning and day-to-day progress tracking and execution.
History of taking ownership and of delivering results in a fast-paced environment, including history of successfully delivering large-scale projects end to end, through the entire life cycle.

Title: Sr. UX Designer, Shopbop UX Team
Job_Description:
7+ years of experience working directly with engineering teams
Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
5+ years of technical program management experience

5+ years of experience managing large, cross-functional projects
Experience with service oriented architecture and object oriented design
Excellent communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem solving and organizational skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field

Title: Sr. UX Designer, Shopbop UX Team
Job_Description:
About Us
Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.
We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.
About the Role
The Mobile Core team builds frameworks and tools to empower mobile engineering teams at Twitch. The team also creates and improves core features such as Video Playback or Authentication. As Senior iOS Engineer on our Mobile Core Team, you will lead important projects which have an outsized impact, collaborating with engineers and partners across the company. You will work with driven mobile engineers on a native app, used by millions of users each day, with modern technologies like Swift, SwiftUI, and GraphQL. You will report to the Senior Engineering Manager for Mobile Core iOS and work remotely or from either our San Francisco, Seattle, Los Angeles, Austin, or our New York City offices.

Title: Sr. UX Designer, Shopbop UX Team
Job_Description:
Experience with object-oriented design
2+ years of professional non-internship experience with front end, web or mobile software development using JavaScript, HTML and CSS

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
3+ years professional experience in software development
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

With Alexa devices proliferating across homes, offices, cars and mobile, Alexa is going to play a significant role in helping customers capture their needs in the moment. The Alexa Shopping List team is enabling this vision by becoming the preferred way to capture and manage customers' grocery needs. By combining the ease of talking to Alexa with social shopping through sophisticated AI to automatically build your list and find you the best deals, we will transform how customers shop in stores and online. We will help customers anticipate and keep track of what they need, help them save time and get the best value while shopping. We will ensure they always get everything on their shopping list without forgetting anything. What you will do: You will have the opportunity to contribute to and develop deep expertise in the areas of distributed systems, machine learning, conversational technologies, front-end app development, data storage and data pipelines. You'll have the freedom (and encouragement) to experiment, improve, invent, and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will have an impact on Amazon's Alexa experiences and the way shopping is done in the area of virtual assistants, chatbots and IoT. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a key contributor to something special from its earliest stages. You will be working closely with multiple product managers and engineers from partner teams in Amazon Retail, Alexa, Speech Recognition and a Research Sciences team. What we are looking for a talented and experienced engineer to design and develop the voice and visual experiences, machine learning models and the distributed systems that bring this vision together. We will welcome previous experience in any one of these areas or a full-stack experience that spans multiple front-end and backend technologies.

Job_Description:
2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

3+ years of experience building successful production software systems
A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals (BS, MS or PhD in CS)
Experience with multi-threading and mobile device memory management
Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs

Title: Project/Program Manager II (Contingent)
Job_Description:
5+ years experience in implementation/project management roles for Large Enterprise companies
BA/BS Degree

Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $25 billion dollar global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.

Implementation Project Manager (PMs) help organizations transform how they view and manage spend and best utilize Amazon Business (AB) for purchasing needs. PMs engage with executives, purchasing leadership and finance leadership to include Amazon Business as a key part of purchasing strategies, tools, and processes. PMs are experts in AB solutions and they structure programs that incorporate AB solutions into existing purchasing processes and/or develop new processes to improve efficiencies and reduce costs. PMs work closely with customers to guide deployments and successfully adopt our solutions. The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across functional areas such as Purchasing, Finance, and IT, project management experience managing complex B2B implementations, and has a proven track record of meeting and exceeding program goals and revenue targets.

This role can be located out of any of the Amazon Business locations in the United States, which include but are not limited to; Austin TX, Boston MA, Arlington VA, Chicago IL, Tempe AZ or Seattle WA as well as parts of the North East regions of the country.

Description
We are seeking a talented individual to join our NA Marketing Business Operations Team, which plays a critical role in Amazon’s Marketing process by executing efficient and accurate processing of purchase orders and invoicing. Reporting to the Operations Business Manager, the ideal candidate will be able to work quickly and accurately to execute SOPs, be comfortable with large transaction volumes and data sets, analyze data flow and processes, dive deep into issues, and a have a passion for finding efficiencies and simplification. This is a role which requires good communication skills and the ability to build relationships with various internal and external teams. We expect all our team members to develop with the company, in line with our tenets and leadership principles and so expect that additional responsibilities to be assigned outside of normal day-to-day activities in line with this personal development. Roles and responsibilities for this position include the following: Action ticket requests to resolve real time invoicing issues with internal teams and external vendors. Create Purchase Orders. Monitor dashboards to get ahead of issues. Support the operations team in tracking accruals and reporting against them. Overlook spend from our Marketing Channels and align monthly tracking with Finance and Accounting.

Job summary Amazon Business – Business Web Services team is seeking an innovative, results-oriented Technical Partnerships Program Manager. The vision of Amazon Business Web Services team is to make secure, high quality APIs which can enable AB like experience in third party systems. The role is a hybrid of 1) Business Development - working with Amazon’s existing Technical Partner teams/organizations that host APIs with us and managing the overall business relationship including developing new commercial opportunities across Amazon team; and 2) Program/Project Management – driving the success of ongoing collaboration initiatives with the Partner. We expect this leader to operate across distributed, cross-functional organizations, with a mix of strategic planning and tactical execution. The key mission of the position is to unlock additional business value for Amazon customers through the management and growth of existing technical partnerships and the identification of new partners aligned to our program mission. This role will be highly visible at senior levels of Amazon Business Tech. You will work closely with partner teams to execute strategies that expand Amazon’s business, maintaining the programs and other business aspects of the partnership while identifying additional opportunities to achieve mutual goals. This role has cross-functional exposure to Product, Marketing, and Engineering. It would be a great fit for 1) commercial-savvy program/ financial leaders seeking to expand partner facing experiences, or 2) business developers seeking to build holistic experiences in Product, Marketing and Project Management. Key job responsibilities • Manage and evolve end-to-end Technical Partnership Program vision • Operate as a business program, with quantified financial and customer impact and clear mechanisms to prioritize and deliver against Spectrum strategic goals • Manage initial triage of Partner product feature requests and hand off to Product/Tech teams • Prepare and deliver regular business reviews to senior management updating on progress on goals, partner feedback, strategic investment opportunities and partner-related roadmap items • Align on partner activities with internal Marketing, Product, Legal and Engineering teams. • Coordinate joint Go-to-Market activities • Steward the nomination, selection and introduction of internal partners in which to invest. About the team Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $25 billion dollar global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide. Amazon Business launched in 2015 with a vision to give businesses a simple, personalized and transparent online B2B experience. An extension of this vision was to simplify the integration for businesses connecting their e-procurement systems to Amazon Business, while giving them access to a broader selection of products and sellers.
· 5 years in a technical writing role on a highly technical subject matter · Degree in Communications, Computer Science, English or a related field · Knowledge of web analytics and reporting · Experience deriving actionable content plans from social media engagement and responses · Experience maintaining a style guide · Familiarity with Open API and Swagger specifications · A working knowledge of a programming language, such as Java, C#, Python, etc… · Experience with Git, GitHub, Markdown, authoring tools, repository management and source control systems Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Job summary Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun. Amazon.com empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands. Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas Amazon Robotics Spring 2023 co-op opportunities will be based out of the Greater Boston Area in our two state-of-the-art facilities in Westborough, MA and North Reading, MA. Both campuses provide a unique opportunity to have direct access to robotics testing labs and manufacturing facilities. Key job responsibilities The TPM Co-op will be responsible for: -Support implementation, maintenance, and growth of strategic programs -Identify, develop, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations. -Collaborate with internal stakeholders to improve a program’s offering and its benefits for our customers -Optimize data availability and visibility on internal wikis -Report program performance to senior business leaders -Define analytical approaches to uncover new insights and formulate recommendations that improve processes

Title: Project/Program Manager II (Contingent)
Job_Description:
About Us
Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.
We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.
About the Role
Are you someone who wants to influence how community engagement works across the world's biggest live streaming service? Do you have a background in technical management and get excited by the idea of building tools that let individuals reach a global audience? Are you passionate about delivering products that delight millions? If so, we'd love you to meet our team who is on the leading edge of online entertainment and changing the way people watch.

Title: Project/Program Manager II (Contingent)
Job_Description:
The Discovery team owns the homepage and navigation features for Amazon worldwide across mobile and desktop devices. Within the Discovery team, Program Management enables product management and the global marketing teams to operate more efficiently at scale by developing and driving adoption of policies, processes, tools and best practices. We maintain the day-to-day cadence of marketing and business operations, support strategic initiatives and are key partners in Homepage stakeholder management to ensure that we always maintain a high bar for our experiences.

Our program team has an an exciting opportunity for a program manager who can help us scale our marketing and business operations to meet the growing needs of the Amazon customers and global stakeholders who use our experiences. As a program manager on the Discovery team, you will interact with teams across Amazon, giving you a birds-eye view of a variety of businesses, programs and initiatives. In this role, you will have the opportunity to impact the day-to-day operations of some of the most visible features on Amazon by implementing large scale process changes and automation initiatives.

Job summary
Amazon Transportation Services (ATS) is looking for a Capacity Planning Manager within the North American Sort Center (NASC) Long Term Planning team. Our team owns the Planning process and the analytics for both US and Canada sort center networks. The Amazon managed transportation network continues to grow in scale and complexity. As we onboard multiple new businesses through the middle mile transportation network - scalable solutions for future business needs, influencing change in our current processes and solutions to increase automation, and adaptation to complexity and ambiguity are critical to success.

We are looking for a strong leader to own our long term planning cycles and to help us design our network to support the Amazon speed and other transportation initiatives. This role will require you to work cross functionally and understand the long term requirements of the all programs that leverage the sort centers. This is a high impact and visibility role, as it requires recommending the future build plans and the capital investment needed for sort centers. As a part of the planning process, you will be interacting with senior-level audiences (including directors and VPs) from both internal and external teams mainly to get their alignment to the recommendation. The role will offer unique opportunity to develop the best-in-class middle mile network for the North American Sort center network to deliver high quality customer experience while minimizing cost and improving fulfillment speed. Besides the planning side, the role offers you to work on the Operations Research based planning tools and partner with research scientists to define new tools or improve existing.

Job summary Amazon's Robotics Artificial Intelligence Organization (RAI) is using spatial AI to provide autonomous mobile robots which facilitate material movement in Amazon Operations, safely and efficiently. By using state-of-the-art cameras and other sensors, the system perceives its surroundings with unrivaled vision and fidelity. The system combines a mix of high-performance sensors with simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) software that builds and continuously updates maps in real-time. It has the capability to ‘see’ and identify different objects, people, vehicles, and places as it moves and reacts to moving objects in an intelligent way. This team is seeking a proven Technical Product Manager with to drive our requirements, roadmap, and multi-year vision for autonomous mobile robots at Amazon. The candidate will collaborate closely with internal customers, partners, software and hardware engineering, research science, field operations. The candidate will execute on the existing product strategy and provide data-driven insights to the autonomous mobile robot vision and product roadmaps. The candidate must be able to systematically consider and clearly communicate tradeoffs between costs, resources, risks, and timelines engineering teams and senior leadership.
